result.execSummary:
The defendant Toni P. Cayton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber/work release.  Jail is stayed until on or before December 18, 2016 between 6-7 a.m.  Conditions of the stay:  Defendant is not to possess or consume alcohol.  Must submit to testing of blood, breath or urine on demand by law enforcement to monitor compliance.  

Costs in this case have been remitted by the Court.

* JOC AMENDED 12-28-16 to indicate 1 day credit.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Toni P. Cayton

records.addlTxt: Toni Cayton called the COC office informs us that his is unable to pay his payment plan this month and will make a payment in December. Approved by Clerk.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: RCSD - Disposition of Warrant or Commitment (Time Served - JOC)
for time credit on sentence; Response from DA Jennifer Harper given to Clerk's Office 12-27-16; Court's response:  12/28/16:  "Granted"

Defendant Toni P. Cayton in court. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Several cases called together:  16CM104, 16CT83, 16TR1281, 16TR1282, 16TR1283, and 16TR1414.  DA states that the parties are ready to proceed to disposition.  Def confirms that there is a plea agreement, however, he argues to the Court re ex post facto, due process, IID, and revocation length considerations.  Court suggests scheduling of a motion hearing.  More discussion.  Def states he want to get this matter done today.  Proceeding with the plea, Court conducts plea colloquy.  Court allows def to proceed as his own representation.  Def pleads no contest to OWI 2nd in 16CT83 and bail jumping in 16CM104.  Further colloquy on pleas.  Finding of guilty.

16CM104 bail jumping -  27 days jail.  Court remits costs.

16CT83 OWI 2nd - 10 jail jail consecutive to 16CM104, 12 mo revocation, 12 mo IID, total $1429, AODA/driver safety plan for relicensing.  60 dtp fine/costs or payment plan if unable to pay in full within 60 days.  Jail is stayed until on or before Dec. 18, 2016 between 6-7 a.m.  Stay conditions:  Defendant is not to possess or consume alcohol.  Must submit to testing of blood, breath or urine on demand by law enforcement to monitor compliance.
Status conference on October 19, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Cases 16CM104, 16TR1283, 16TR1281, 16TR1282, 16TR1414 called together. Defendant Toni P. Cayton in court. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Atty Harper stated that she had made def a proposal. Def states he'd like to accept it. All matters are reset.  Status conference scheduled for October 19, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on October 11, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Toni P. Cayton in court. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin and Richland County in the various cases called together for status:  16CM104, 16TR1281, 1282, 1283, 16TR1414.  Atty. Jay Robb appears for the City of RC in 16TR1492, also on the calendar for status (OWI 1st case).  

16TR1492 - city case - def pleads no contest.  09 pbt.  Finding of guilty.  Sentence, per guidelines:  $811.50, 6 mo revocation, AODA/driver safety plan.  60 dtp or payment plan if unable to pay in full within 60 days.

16CM104, 16TR1281, 1282, 1283, and 16TR1414 all reset to 10/11 at 1:30.  Status conference scheduled for October 11, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
The District Attorney has asked that this case track with others that the def presently has open.  All are set for status 10/3 at 1:30.
Status conference on October 3, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Toni P. Cayton in court.  Court called this matter during TR/FO court.  Prosecutor has already asked that def's matters be bundled together/track together with additional status in all October 3 at 1:30.  Clerk of court provided def with written notice of this date/time.  Status conference scheduled for October 3, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
AMENDED - same conditions; daily reporting time for pbt test has been changed from 6:00-9:00am to 5:00-8:00pm.

Status conference on September 15, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 19, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Toni P. Cayton appeared by video means from the Richland County Jail where he is in custody on another case (has a signature bond in this case). Prosecuting Atty John L. Conlon appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Def asks to have a pretrial conference with the DA and to "bundle" his matters together - has court again 9/15 at 10.  Clerk notes that 9/15 at 10 is the intake date for non-criminal TR tickets; in those matters, def has pretrial with the DA on 9/19 at 1:30.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 19, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Status conference scheduled for September 15, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Request by def to change daily pbt reporting time
